result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Wayne E Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with Jeffrey Menter, unless otherwise permitted by the court only.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wayne E Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Cash bond applied; partial refund;   ds/mg   ck#17CH

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Max Stephenson.  The DE has successfully completed the DPA.  Therefore, the State is moving to dismiss ct. 2.  Clerk D. Smith.
Stipulated Hold Open Agreement on Count 2 - 12 months.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Wayne E Smith, appeared with Attorney Max T Stephenson.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  
Count 1 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year with conditions.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  No contact with Jeffrey M. 
Count 2 - DE pleads Guilty; judgment is withheld and parties enter into a Stipulated Hold Open Agreement for 1 year.  Bond continues pending hold open agreement.  DPA Hearing on 3/17/17 at 8:30 AM

15CM1527 & 16CM108 - Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Max Stephenson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Parties are close to resolving the cases.  Plea and sentencing 3/9/16 at 8:40.  Bonds continued.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Max Stephenson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Plea of not guilty entered.  FPT 2/18/16 at 9:00.  Bond set at $1,000.00 signature w/conditon no contact with Jeffrey M. or his residence.  ($650.00 cash bond to be returned to the poster.)
